lines.text: A crime is awful! Think of the poor girl!

I've seen a corpse or two - their heads in the wind, cut in half, mouth open. I've seen three or four piled together. Kids with their eyes punctured. Indo-Chinese as old as Madame Tirrant completely torn to bits. I've seen pals of mine rotting in the sun, being eaten by maggots.
Yes, war is a horrible thing. That's a fact, but murder like this - it's barbaric!
We counted corpses by the truckload, so... I'm rambling.
But, shit, I asked you if I kissed you now, what would you say?
I'd say nothing, but please don't.

[Walking through a cavern]
You must understand that the instincts, the feelings, and even the intelligence of Cro-Magnon man was definitely human. The only differences to the problem were his needs to survive.
It means to stay alive. He began to draw. Do you know what we call desires when they lose their savage quality? Aspirations. If Cro-Magnon had not survived, the world in which we live wouldn't exist.
If you never make love, you go crazy.
